comment.author: 86047400@N07
comment._content:
The upper-level photo features the walled fence of the Government House (or Governor's residence) on the right, and the walled Antigua Recreation Grounds on the left. The street was called East Street, marking the east boundary of the City of St. John's. The photographer is looking south, and the photo was taken in the morning, given that the shadows of the trees are looming westward.
Ambassador  Lionel Hurst (ret)
MaxHurst@aol.com

comment.author: 31575009@N05
comment._content: Extremely interesting. I'll amend the description accordingly.

comment.author: 87298822@N05
comment._content: Nice picture! How lovely the trees outside the A.R.G. were!

comment.author: 87828352@N05
comment._content: The lower-level photo shows the southern gate of the Governor's residence which takes you on to Church Street, just west of the Roman Catholic Church.
